newsitem.title: GERMANY: VW says no decision yet on subsidies issue.
newsitem.headline: VW says no decision yet on subsidies issue.

text.p: Volkswagen AG said on Wednesday that no decision has been made yet on ending a subsidy dispute with Brussels over controversial aid to the German carmaker for east German plants.
VW spokesman Peter Schlelein, responding to a report in Germany's Handelsblatt newspaper saying the dispute would soon be ended, said a number of suggestions were under discussion.

The newspaper reported on Wednesday that the European Union was prepared to drop its objections to the subsidies for VW plants in the east German state of Saxony in exchange for VW agreeing to invest more in a west German plant in Baunatal.
European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert had proposed in December that extra investment could justify subsidies already granted. VW said at the time it would review the offer.
VW and Brussels have been at odds over the awarding of about 240 million marks ($140.4 million) in investment help by Saxony last summer for the construction of two car plants.
The German federal government has frozen some of that aid and VW has said it would not draw on it until an agreement with Brussels is reached on the issue.
